meanings.definition: The maximum useful work possible during a process.
meanings.sent1: The exergy of the system determines the work it can perform.
meanings.sent2: Engineers use exergy to analyze energy efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The exergy of the old machine was so high, it seemed to have a mind of its own!
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like the exergy of a well-oiled machine, producing masterpiece after masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The exergy of the sun powers all life on Earth.

meanings.definition: The measure of the potential of a system to do work.
meanings.sent1: Understanding exergy helps in designing efficient systems.
meanings.sent2: The exergy of a battery indicates its capacity to perform.
meanings.sent3: The exergy of the clock was so high that it ticked with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: His exergy in problem-solving was like a wellspring of endless solutions.
meanings.sent5: The exergy of a seed holds the promise of a mighty tree.
